DOC.brief_summary: Purpose : To evaluate effect replace breakfast high protein , high fat , high fiber meal replacement overweight individual , body composition . Participants : Healthy , overweight obese individual ( age 18-45 yr ) history disease . Procedures ( method ) : In randomize control intervention , subject complete 5 different test session ( pre-screening , 2 baseline testing session , 2 post testing session ) well 8 week intervention period . Pre-screening include write informed consent , health history questionnaire , nutrition analysis , baseline anthropometric measure . Baseline test split two session include measurement rest metabolic rate ( RMR ) , body composition , blood saliva hormone , mood , satiety , health relate quality life questionnaire , cardiorespiratory fitness assessment . Subjects randomly assign treatment ( 8 week supplementation meal replacement take breakfast ) control group ( continue normal eating habit ) 4 electronic correspondence throughout supplementation period . All measure repeat two post-testing session .
DOC.criteria: Healthy , Overweight Men PreMenopausal Women Participant agree maintain usual activity lifestyle Participant body mass index ≥ 28 ( men ) ≥25 ( woman ) kg/m2 and/or % body fat ≥ 25 % Participant provide write date informed consent participate study Participant willing able comply protocol Participant apparently healthy free disease , determine health history questionnaire ( diabetes , heart disease , kidney disease , cancer , thyroid disorder , etc ) . Participant agree abstain smoking , caffeine , tobacco , alcohol test day Participant state goal lose weight improve body composition Having history medical surgical event may significantly affect study outcome , include cardiovascular disease , metabolic , renal , hepatic , musculoskeletal disorder ( i.e . anything influencing exercise ability ) .
